refnamediv.refpurpose: Generic manual page for dome drivers.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page describes dome drivers availabe in RTS2 and their common options. For description of options common to all devices, please consult rts2-device7.
Special class of dome is cupola, which has slit (similar to dome roof) and azimuth angle. This is discussed in rts2-cupola7 manual page.

refentry.refsect1:
OPTIONS
&optiongnu;
&basicapplist; --weather-can-open
Enables opening of the dome (switching to on) if weather is good. If not specified, dome will not open in good weather. You would like to have this option for a fully autonomous setup, but it is better to avoid it for a human supervised (or not yet fully proven) operation. Be aware that if you specify this option, dome might open during night.
You can also change this option from rts2-mon1, it is available as weather_open value.
--state-master master server
Master server. Basic state transitions (day,evening,dusk,night,dawn,morning) are accepted only from a single master server. if you specify multiple servers with --server option, you must specify one as the master server.
--notclose
Do not close dome after deamon startup. Set next_open 5 minutes back, so the dome will be in a good weather state at startup.
&deviceapplist;

refsect1.title: Dome variables
refsect1.para: Dome modules present user following variables:

listitem.para: If dome should trigger transition to ready state when system present good weather. Use with care, as when set, dome will open whenever system thinks it is a good weather. Do not use if your system has insufficient or unrealible weather sensing sensors.

Ignore bad weather for given time. Can be set interactively from rts2-mon1. Dome will then ignore bad weather and will switch system to bold state, possibly resulting in opening of the dome and observations being taken.

Use this option to override bad weather detected by the system. Please be aware that certain dome models (Zelio) have usually rain sensor wired directly into roof control PLC, and this cannot be overrided.

Time of next dome opening. Set to some value in future if bad weather is detected or triggered by the dome. Indicates that dome thinks the weather is bad and will not open at least for specified amount of time.

rts2-dome-zelio 1
various Zelio PLC controlled domes.

refsect1.title: Operations of dome over multiple telescopes
refsect1.para: Dome, as well as most of the RTS2 components, can be operated under multiple central servers. So if your observatory setup includes two or more experiments under common roof, you should connect your dome to multiple rts2-centrald1 instances. This setup is usuall for observatories with telescope and all sky camera.
Following should be taken into account when running dome on multiple observatories:

listitem.para: Otherwise, dome driver will be unable to decide which rts2-centrald1 (specified as the argument) states to follow.

In order for the dome to open, all connected observatories must be in at least standby state, and bad weather state bit shall not be set. Please note that dome will not switch to on (if the --weather-can-open was specified) and dome will not open (will refuse open command) if at least one of the centrald has bad weather raised.
There isn't currently any other way to check for the centrald than to run rts2-mon5 on all rts2-centrald1 (or use json or similar external access to RTS2).
